glosses: broom, besom, whisk, a domestic utensil used for sweeping

etymology:
Inherited from Ottoman Turkish سوپوركه (süpürge), from Proto-Turkic *sipürge (“broom”). By surface analysis, süpür- (“to sweep”) + -ge.
Cognates
Cognate with Azerbaijani süpürgə, Turkmen süpürgi, Tatar себерке (seberke), Northern Altai сыбырга (sïbïrga), Khakas сыбырғы (sıbırğı), Kazakh сыпырғыш (sypyrğyş), Kyrgyz шыпыргы (şıpırgı), Southern Altai сибирги (sibirgi), Crimean Tatar sipirki, Uzbek supurgi, and Uyghur سۈپۈرگە (süpürge).
